golad.lib

Interface Board

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutableBoard
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBoard, AbstractMutableBoard, DefaultBoard, DelegateBoard

    public interface Board
    This interface represents a GOLAD board which's state can be examined. A GOLAD board is a finite 2 dimensional cartesian grid of cells. In this specification, the top-leftmost cell is at coordinates (0,0), and the bottom-rightmost cell is at coordinates (getWidth()-1,getHeight()-1) If the implementing class allows the state of a GOLAD board to be altered, it should implement MutableBoard.
    Author:
    Megacrafter127
    See Also:
    MutableBoard

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAliveNeighborCount(int x, int y)
      Returns the current number of alive neighbors of a specified cell.
      CellState getCellStateAt(int x, int y)
      Returns the current state of the cell at the specified coordinates.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of this Board.
      int getNeighborCellCount(int x, int y, Set<CellState> states)
      Returns the current number of neighbors of a specified cell, that are in any of the specified CellStates.
      int getTotalCellCount(Set<CellState> states)
      Returns the current number of cells in any of the specified CellStates.
      int getWidth()
      Returns the width of this Board.
      Board iterate()
      Generates the state of this Board after one iteration of GOLAD, and returns a Board containing it.

        CellState getCellStateAt(int x,
                       int y)
                         throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the current state of the cell at the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the probed cell
        y - The Y coordinate of the probed cell
        Returns:
        the state of the probed cell
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified coordinates are outside of this board.

      • getAliveNeighborCount

        int getAliveNeighborCount(int x,
                        int y)
                          throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the current number of alive neighbors of a specified cell. A cell is considered alive if CellState.alive is true.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the specified cell
        y - The Y coordinate of the specified cell
        Returns:
        the number of alive neighbors
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified coordinates are outside of this board.

      • getNeighborCellCount

        int getNeighborCellCount(int x,
                       int y,
                       Set<CellState> states)
                         throws IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                NullPointerException
        Returns the current number of neighbors of a specified cell, that are in any of the specified CellStates.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the specified cell
        y - The Y coordinate of the specified cell
        states - The set of the specified CellStates
        Returns:
        the number of neighbors
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified coordinates are outside of this board.
        NullPointerException - If states is null.

      • iterate

        Board iterate()
        Generates the state of this Board after one iteration of GOLAD, and returns a Board containing it. Preferably the returned Board should be of the same class as this Board.
        Returns:
        a Board in the state which this board would be in after one iteration of GOLAD.
